Kenneth Stanley wrote:

>Good question...that was a pretty vague article.  Does anyone know 
>where the actual scientific publivacation is?  It sounded like 
>a "shortcut" is a direct connection between two neurons that were 
>previously only connected by a path.  There may be something to the 
>idea of detecting common paths and temporarily replacing them with 
>something simpler...though I don't really know if that's the main 
>idea here.
>
Yes it is a bit vague isn't it, but then New Scientist is a science 
magazine rather than a journal. Also I think part of the reason is that 
this seems to be research into biological nets (although a computer 
model was mentioned). I took the shortcut to mean a new connection 
between two previously distant neurons, but not as a replacement of 
existing connections, just a new connection that provided a feedback 
that kept a signal looping through the network - In their words "the 
network formed self-sustaining loops of activity".

I couldn't find the source of the article so I took the liberty of 
emailing one of the people involved. It's probably based on a recent 
journal article.

Colin.
